intro: Cardamine flaccida f. grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered watercress, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and woodland floors. The plant features small, kidney-shaped leaves and produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. Its flowers are usually arranged in racemes and are characterized by their slender, elongated petals. The species is notable for its ability to thrive in aquatic or semi-aquatic conditions, making it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
